div.p: Viennese publishing house located at Vienna I, Graben 29a (corner of Trattnerhof), publisher of the periodical Der Dreiklang.

Krystall-Verlag functioned between the 1922 and 1938, producing books and periodicals on a range of artistic and sociological matters (it arose out of the Dorotheum ‒ the long-established Austrian auction house). In music, its list included Hans E. Wind, Die Endkrise der bürgerlichen Musik und die Rolle Arnold Schönbergs (1935).

div.head: Krystall-Verlag and Schenker
div.p: Krystall-Verlag was the publisher of the Schenkerian journal Der Dreiklang. The written agreement, dated January 28, 1937, between the publisher's director, Franz Juraschek, and the joint editors of the periodical, Oswald Jonas and Felix Salzer, is preserved as OJ 36/169.
